{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox comedian |name = Nikki Glaser |image = Nikki Glaser.jpg |caption = Glaser performing in August 2016 |alma_mater = [[University of Kansas]] |birth_name = Nicole Rene Glaser{{cite web|url=http://birth-records.mooseroots.com/l/12281355/Nicole-Rene-Glaser|title=Nicole Rene Glaser (b. 1984)|publisher=|accessdate=February 11, 2016}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1984|6|1}} |birth_place = [[Cincinnati]], [[Ohio]], U.S. |medium = [[Stand-up comedy]]
[[Podcast]]ing
Television |nationality = American |active = 2002–present |spouse = |children = |notable_work=''[[Not Safe with Nikki Glaser]]''
''[[Nikki & Sara Live]]''
''[[@midnight]]'' | website = {{url|http://www.nikkiglaser.com/}} }} '''Nicole Rene "Nikki" Glaser''' (born June 1, 1984) is an [[United States|American]] [[stand-up comedian]], [[podcast]] host, and television host. She was the host of the television series ''[[Not Safe with Nikki Glaser]]'', which premiered on [[Comedy Central]] and [[Much (TV channel)|Much]] on February 9, 2016. ==Early life== Glaser was born in [[Cincinnati]], [[Ohio]], the daughter of Julie E. (née Burke) and Edward J. Glaser.{{cite web |url=http://www.stltoday.com/entertainment/television/gail-pennington/st-louis-comic-nikki-glaser-is-headed-for-mtv-late/article_200d6d94-5350-55d4-8edb-8a38a0bde834.html |title=St. Louis comic Nikki Glaser is headed for MTV late-night |publisher=St Louis Post-Dispatch |date=January 24, 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://thehalperts.com/genealogy/Default/PersPage_12294.html|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140413140942/http://thehalperts.com/genealogy/Default/PersPage_12294.html|archivedate=April 13, 2014|deadurl=yes|title=Nikki Glaser|website=thehalperts.com|accessdate=July 4, 2017}} She has German and Irish ancestry. Glaser spent most of her childhood in [[St. Louis]], [[Missouri]].{{cite web |url=http://splitsider.com/2011/01/the-life-of-th-road-warrior-with-nikki-glaser/ |title=The Life of the Road Warrior with Nikki Glaser |publisher=Splitsider |date=January 27, 2011}} She graduated from [[Kirkwood High School]], attended the [[University of Kansas]], and graduated with a degree in [[English Literature]].{{cite web|url=http://youhadtobethere.libsyn.com/|title=You Had To Be There|publisher=|accessdate=February 11, 2016}} ==Career== ===Stand-up comedy=== Glaser started performing stand-up at the age of 18. Since then, Glaser has performed stand-up on ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'', ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'', and two seasons of ''Last Comic Standing''.{{cite web |url=http://thelaughbutton.com/news/nikki-glaser-tape-comedy-central-pilot-nsfw-wnikki-glaser/ |title=Nikki Glaser to tape Comedy Central pilot, NSFW w/Nikki Glaser |publisher=The Laugh Button |date=December 2, 2014}} ===Podcast & Radio=== From 2011-2014, Glaser hosted a podcast with comedian [[Sara Schaefer]] called ''You Had To Be There''. In March 2015, Glaser appeared on [[Giant Bomb]]'s life advice podcast, Danswers, talking about subjects such as her experience with co-host Dan Ryckert at college.{{cite web| url= http://giantbomb.com/podcasts/danswers-04-nikki-glaser/1600-1158/ | website= GiantBomb.com | title= Danswers 04: Nikki Glaser| accessdate= February 3, 2016}} Glaser co-hosted the podcast ''We Know Nothing'' with comedian [[Phil Hanley]] and roommate/musician [[Anya Marina]]. ''We Know Nothing'' is a humorous relationship-based podcast that takes calls from listeners and attempts to give them love advice. In 2015, she left the podcast after she determined that it was interfering with her personal relationships.{{citation needed|date=June 2015}} From January to October 2016, she hosted the companion podcast to her Comedy Central show "Not Safe" with Dan St. Germain and Brian Frange. Each episode they discussed sex and relationship issues as well as apples.{{cite web| url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/not-safe-podcast-with-nikki-glaser/id1072434264?mt=2 |title=Not Safe Podcast with Nikki Glaser |publisher=iTunes}} In February 2018, she began hosting ''You Up? With Nikki Glaser'', a daily radio show on Sirius XM. ===Television=== ''[[Nikki & Sara Live]]'', a weekly sex show television series hosted by Glaser and Schaefer, premiered on January 29, 2013, on MTV.{{cite news|last=Angelo|first=Megan|title=Friends First, Talk-Show Hosts Later|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/12/30/arts/television/nikki-glaser-and-sara-schaefer-get-ready-for-mtv.html|accessdate=December 30, 2012|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=December 28, 2012}} The show was canceled on October 29, 2013, after two seasons.{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/11/22/nikki-sara-live-canceled-after-two-seasons-by-mtv/217443/|title='Nikki & Sara Live' Canceled After Two Seasons by MTV|last=Kondolojy|first=Amanda|work=TV by the Numbers|date=November 22, 2013}} Glaser has also appeared on [[MTV]] shows such as ''Money from Strangers'', ''[[Awkward (TV series)|Awkward. After Show. You're Welcome.]]'', and ''[[Failosophy]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.mtv.com/shows/nikki_and_sara/cast_member.jhtml?personalityId=15828 |title=Nikki & Sara LIVE: Cast |publisher=MTV |accessdate=June 30, 2014}} On June 2, 2015, [[Comedy Central]] greenlit a sex-themed talk show hosted by Glaser, titled ''[[Not Safe with Nikki Glaser]]''. The show premiered on February 9, 2016.{{cite web |url=http://www.avclub.com/article/nikki-glaser-getting-her-own-raunchy-comedy-centra-220243 |title=Nikki Glaser is getting her own raunchy Comedy Central show |publisher=A.V Club |date=June 2, 2015}} [[Not Safe with Nikki Glaser]] is now shown in the UK on [[4Music]]. The show was cancelled in November 2016. On September 5, 2016, Nikki appeared on the ''[[Comedy Central Roast|Comedy Central Roast of Rob Lowe]]'' as a Roaster.[http://www.cc.com/shows/roast-of-rob-lowe "ALL THE ROB THAT'S FIT TO ROAST"] Retrieved September 6, 2016. She appeared on the [[Comedy Central Roast]] of Bruce Willis on July 28, 2018.{{Cite web|url=http://www.cc.com/shows/roast-of-bruce-willis|title=Roast of Bruce Willis|website=Comedy Central|access-date=2018-08-01}} ===Film=== Glaser played a small role in [[Henry Phillips (comedian)|Henry Phillips]]' 2009 film ''[[Punching the Clown]]''.{{cite web| url= https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1192624/fullcredits#cast | title= Cast of ''Punching the Clown''| website=[[Internet Movie Database]]}} She also appeared as herself in [[Jordan Brady]]'s documentary ''[[I Am Comic]]'',{{cite web| url= https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1568926/fullcredits#cast |title= Cast of ''I Am Comic'' | website= Internet Movie Database}} and its sequel, ''[[I Am Road Comic]]''.{{cite web| url= https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3883282/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1 |title= ''I Am Road Comic'' | website= Internet Movie Database}} Glaser had a role in the [[Judd Apatow]]-directed film ''[[Trainwreck (film)|Trainwreck]]'' (2015).{{cite web |url=http://nerdist.com/interview-amy-schumer-judd-apatow-on-bringing-trainwreck-to-life/ |title=Interview: Amy Schumer & Judd Apatow on Bringing TRAINWRECK to Life |website=Nerdist.com |date=April 29, 2015}} ==Personal life== Glaser has voiced opinions on what she views as "[[rape culture]]", following [[People v. Turner|the Brock Turner case]],{{cite web|last1=Romano|first1=Nick|title=Channing Tatum on Stanford rape case: 'Rape culture is a very real thing'|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/06/25/channing-tatum-stanford-rape-brock-turner-cosmopolitan|website=EW.com|accessdate=5 July 2016 |date=25 June 2016 |quote=Tatum joins the likes of Lena Dunham and Comedy Central’s Nikki Glaser, who’ve spoken out about rape culture in light of the Stanford case.}} suggesting Judge [[Aaron Persky]], who handed down Turner's sentence, should be a synonym for rape apologist.{{cite web|last1=Bacle|first1=Ariana|title=Nikki Glaser slams Stanford rape case judge on Not Safe|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/06/20/not-safe-nikki-glaser-stanford-rape-case|website=EW.com|accessdate=5 July 2016}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="background:#; height:10px;"| Year ! style="background:#; height:10px;"| Title ! style="background:#; height:10px;"| Role ! style="background:#; height:10px;"| Notes |- |rowspan="3"| 2009 || ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'' || Herself || |- | ''[[Punching the Clown]]'' || Olympia || |- | ''[[It's On with Alexa Chung]]'' || Herself || |- | 2010 || ''[[I Am Comic]]'' || Herself || |- | 2011-12 || ''[[Red Eye (TV series)|Red Eye]]'' || Panelist || Has appeared on two episodes |- | 2012 || ''[[Awkward (TV series)|Awkward. After Show. You're Welcome.]]'' || Host || Co-hosted with [[Sara Schaefer]] |- | rowspan="7" | 2013 || ''[[Nikki & Sara Live]]'' || Host/Creator || Co-hosted and co-created with Sara Schaefer |- |''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' || Herself || |- |''[[Totally Biased with W. Kamau Bell]]'' || Guest || |- | ''[[Last Call with Carson Daly]]'' || Guest || |- | ''[[The Half Hour]]'' || Herself || Season 2 Episode 2: Stand-up comedy set |- | ''[[Inside Amy Schumer]]'' || Amanda || Episode 3: A Porn Star Is Born |- | ''Women Who Kill'' || Herself || |- |rowspan"1"| 2013–17 || ''[[@midnight]]'' || Herself || Has appeared in twenty episodes. |- |rowspan="3"| 2014 || ''[[Big Morning Buzz Live]] || Herself || |- | ''[[Adam DeVine's House Party]]'' || Herself || Season 2 Episode 7: Marriage Material |- | ''I Am Road Comic'' || Herself || |- |rowspan="3"| 2015 || ''[[The View (U.S. TV series)|The View]] || Guest co-host || |- | ''[[VH1 Top 20 Countdown]]'' || Guest co-host || |- | ''[[Trainwreck (film)|Trainwreck]]'' || Lisa || |- |rowspan="6"| 2016 || ''[[The Late Late Show with James Corden]] || Herself || |- | ''[[Not Safe with Nikki Glaser]]'' || Herself/Host || |- | ''Nikki Glaser's Perfect'' || Herself || |- | ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' || Guest || Herself | |- | ''[[And Punching the Clown]]'' || Claire the Bartender || |- | ''[[Comedy Central Roast|Comedy Central Roast of Rob Lowe]]'' || Herself/roaster || Television special |- | rowspan="2"|2017 || ''The Standups'' || Herself || |- |''[[Adam Ruins Everything#Season 2 (2017–18)|Adam Ruins Everything]] || Sallie Mae || Episode: ''Adam Ruins College'' |- |rowspan="4"| 2018 || ''[[A.P. Bio]]'' || Chloe from Baltimore || |- |''[[Alone Together (TV series)|Alone Together]] ''|| Annette || Episode: ''Property Management'' |- | ''[[The Comedy Central Roast]]'' | Herself | Episode: “Bruce Willis” |- |- | ''[[Jeff Ross Presents Roast Battle]]'' | Judge | |} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== * [http://nikkiglaser.com/ NikkiGlaser.com] * {{Twitter}} * {{instagram|nikkiglaser|Nikki Glaser}} * {{facebook|OfficialNikkiGlaser|Nikki Glaser}} * {{IMDb name|3218751}} * [http://youhadtobetherepodcast.tumblr.com/ You Had To Be There website] * [http://www.kansascity.com/entertainment/article89598237.html 2016 Nikki Glaser interview] with Jon Niccum {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Glaser, Nikki}} [[Category:1984 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:21st-century American actresses]] [[Category:Actresses from Cincinnati]] [[Category:Actresses from St. Louis]] [[Category:American film actresses]] [[Category:American podcasters]] [[Category:American stand-up comedians]] [[Category:American television actresses]] [[Category:American women comedians]] [[Category:Comedians from Missouri]] [[Category:Comedians from Ohio]] [[Category:Late night television talk show hosts]] [[Category:University of Kansas alumni]] [[Category:21st-century American comedians]]
